title: Bisca (Bishopric)
text:
Bisica was a <a href="civitas">civitas</a> of <a href="Roman%20North%20Africa">Roman North Africa</a>, tentatively identified with <a href="ruins">ruins</a> at <a href="Bijga">Bijga</a> in today's <a href="Tunisia">Tunisia</a>.
Bishopric.
Bisca was the <a href="cathedra">seat</a> of an ancient <a href="bishopric">episcopal see</a> of the <a href="Roman%20province">Roman province</a> of <a href="Proconsular%20Africa">Proconsular Africa</a>, and a suffragan of the <a href="archdiocese%20of%20Carthage">Bishop of Carthage</a>.
There are two documented bishops of this site. 
Today Bisica survives as a <a href="titular%20bishop">titular bishop</a>ric and the current titular bishop is <a href="Andrew%20H.%20Cozzens">Andrew Harmon Cozzens</a>, auxiliary <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Archdiocese%20of%20Saint%20Paul%20and%20Minneapolis">bishop of Saint Paul and Minneapolis</a>.
